dmca.title: Urgent Notice of Copyright Infringement Involving a Fraudulent Charter One Bank Websi
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Jack Johnson [mailto:jack.johnson@markmonitor.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, March 23, 2005 5:08 PM
To: abuse@theplanet.com; copyright@theplanet.com; aalmeida@theplanet.com
Cc: DC-OPS
Subject: Urgent Notice of Copyright Infringement Involving a Fraudulent
Charter One Bank Website

Dear ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.:
 
I am the representative of Charter One Bank ("Bank"), which operates its
online banking operations at http://www.charteronebank.com.  
 
Please be advised that one of your customers appears to be using your
network or systems to facilitate a "phishing" scam designed to steal the
confidential personal information of customers of the Bank.  We are
providing you this letter of notification pursuant to the Digital Millennium
Copyright Act 17 USC Section 512(c) ("DMCA") to make ThePlanet.com Internet
Services, Inc. aware of material on its network or system that infringes the
exclusive copyright rights of the Bank.
This notice is addressed to you as the agent designated by ThePlanet.com
Internet Services, Inc. to receive notifications of claimed infringement, as
so reflected in the current records of the U.S.
Copyright Office.  Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that I am
authorized to act on behalf of the Bank whose exclusive copyright rights are
being infringed as described herein.  
 
The Bank has a good faith belief that the Internet site found at the
following ip address 67.18.75.101 ("IP Address") infringes the rights of the
Bank by using copyrighted portions of the Bank's web site to create a fake
site that appears to belong to the Bank. The Bank believes that the offender
will attempt to steal funds from the bank accounts of the customers who
respond to the e-mail request.
 
Due to the serious nature of this problem, we are asking for your immediate
assistance to shut this website down.  As authorized by the DMCA, the Bank
hereby demands that ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
immediately remove or disable access to the Infringing Material at the IP
address identified above. As you may know, the DMCA provides that if this
information is not removed after receipt of a proper DMCA notice, the
Internet Service Provider may also be held liable for the copyright
infringement.
 
Please note that the Markmonitor Anti-Fraud Operations Center is assisting
the Bankmonitor and respond to incidents of online fraud targeted at the
Bank and its customers. Should you have questions regarding this notice or
have any information regarding this matter, please contact the Anti-Fraud
Operations Center at 1(888) No-PHISH or by replying to this e-mail.  Please
also include the above noted Reference Number in the subject line of all
e-mail correspondence.
 
Thank you for your cooperation in this matter. Your immediate response can
prevent other innocent victims from falling prey to this fraudulent scam. 
 
Sincerely,
 
 
-Jack Johnson
 
1(888) No-PHISH
MarkMonitor Operations Center
